text: <@UPV1HUCBH> We are testing several product market fits. So the website is different positioning than the google doc. I’m sorry if I was not more explicit about this, but we are simply testing language to see how people react. #startup :wink:

<@UHWC9PXBL> Awesome feedback :thumbsup:
Let me try this:
Here’s Alice, she’s interested in backend development. The container-world, infrastructure and devops is a little confusing…after all Alice just wants to prototype an enpoint to upload a video, ML to detect what objects are int, compress it, archive it and return a storage url. Alice discovered Storyscript. She was able to describe her business-logic in simple terms and get the job done in minutes because the tooling helped auto-complete, the services were ready-to-use like libraries and no-plumbing deployments.

(not real code, just concepts to illustrate the idea)
```
when http server listen method:"post" path:"/upload" as req
    video = req.files["upload"]
    topics = machinebox/videobox detect input:video
    res = psql insert table:"videos" data:{..stuff from above..}
    video = someOpenSourceCompressor compress video:video
    storage put content:video dest:"/{res['uuid']}.mp4"
    req write content:"/{res['uuid']}.mp4"
```

Alice had a JSFiddle-like way to rapidly prototype this but in a production-grade environment. Like Glitch, but open source and polyglot. But Zapier-like services are native libraries in our language.

<@UJKKBAMLL> Ah okay that makes sense. Actually, I'm doing the same right now. :smile: Yet as a visitor I didn't expect it to be done to me, funny. As a first instinct, I would suggest you to somehow highlight that to your visitors, but then I am not doing it either.. Hm! :slightly_smiling_face:
